Package ides.api.core

Interface OptionsPane

  • public interface OptionsPane
    The interface for modules that will appear in the Options dialog box. The OptionsWindow lets the user select from a list of sections, where each section displays a different set of controls that let the user modify the appplication settings. Each application module or plugin can register its own section by calling Hub.registerOptionsPane(OptionsPane) and providing an OptionsPane as an argument. The set of controls for the module or plugin have to appear in the JPanel that is returned by the getPane() method.

    The protocol for calls to the methods in the interface is as follows:

    • A call to getTitle() can be made at any time.
    • After a call to getPane() and before the first call to disposePane() that follows it: all calls to resetOptions() and commitOptions() should be acknowledged and all calls to getPane() should return a pointer to the same JPanel that was returned in the first place.
    • After a call to disposePane() and before the first call to getPane() that follows it: all calls to disposePane(), resetOptions() and commitOptions() should be ignored.
    In other words, the JPanel with the options controls should only exist in between a call to getPane() and the first disposePane() that follows it; and only during this time should calls to resetOptions() and commitOptions() be acknowledged.
    See Also:
    OptionsWindow, Hub.registerOptionsPane(OptionsPane), getTitle(), getPane(), disposePane(), resetOptions(), commitOptions()

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void commitOptions()
      Commit all settings from the controls in the JPanel.
      void disposePane()
      Called when it is safe to dispose of the JPanel with the settings controls.
      javax.swing.JPanel getPane()
      Returns the JPanel which contains the options controls for this OptionsPane.
      java.lang.String getTitle()
      Returns the string which will appear in the list of sections in the Optins dialog box.
      void resetOptions()
      Reset all settings of the controls in the JPanel.

    • Method Detail

      • getTitle

        java.lang.String getTitle()
        Returns the string which will appear in the list of sections in the Optins dialog box. The user will identify the options controls in this OptionsPane with this string.
        Returns:
        the title of the section containing this options pane
        See Also:
        OptionsWindow

      • getPane

        javax.swing.JPanel getPane()
        Returns the JPanel which contains the options controls for this OptionsPane. This JPanel will be displayed in the Options dialog box when the user selects the section for this options pane.

        This method may be called numerous times during one session. Do not construct a new JPanel for each call unless disposePane() has been called. If disposePane() has not been called, simply pass a reference to the same object.

        Returns:
        the JPanel with the options controls.
        See Also:
        OptionsWindow, disposePane()

      • resetOptions

        void resetOptions()
        Reset all settings of the controls in the JPanel. This method will usually be invoked when the user chooses to cancel any choices they have made. The module or plugin must not change behavor.

        This method may be called a number between calls to getPane(). You must not dispose of the OptionsPane after a call to this method.

        Ignore if called before a call to getPane().

        See Also:
        getPane(), disposePane(), OptionsWindow

      • commitOptions

        void commitOptions()
        Commit all settings from the controls in the JPanel. This method will usually be invoked when the user chooses to accept any choices thay have made. The module or plugin must change behavior according to the new settings.

        This method may be called a number between calls to getPane(). You must not dispose of the OptionsPane after a call to this method.

        Ignore if called before a call to getPane().

        See Also:
        getPane(), disposePane(), OptionsWindow

      • disposePane

        void disposePane()
        Called when it is safe to dispose of the JPanel with the settings controls.

        Ignore if called before a call to getPane().

        See Also:
        getPane(), OptionsWindow
